question: Which are the two countries that jointly involved in the ownership of "Concordia Research Station"?
option4: United States of America and Canada
explanation: Concordia Research Station, which opened in 2005, is a French-Italian research facility that was built at a location called Dome C on the Antarctic Plateau, Antarctica. It is the third permanent, all-year research station on the Antarctic Plateau besides Vostok Station of Russia and the Amundsen-Scott South Pole Station of the USA at the Geographic South Pole. It is jointly operated by the scientists from France and Italy and regularly hosts European Space Agency scientists.
